snippet: To the Editor:    Re ''Doctors Given Federal Threat on Marijuana'' (front page, Dec. 31): Apparently California's Proposition 215, which legalizes marijuana for medical use, wasn't so badly written after all.    As its drafters knew, if doctors wr...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Doctors Given Federal Threat on Marijuana'' (front page, Dec. 31): Apparently California's Proposition 215, which legalizes marijuana for medical use, wasn't so badly written after all. As its drafters knew, if doctors wrote a prescription for marijuana they would be subject to Federal punishment -- regardless of California law. That is why the proposition requires only a verbal or written recommendation from a doctor, not a prescription.
abstract: Rose Ann Fuhrman letter charges Clinton Administration would abridge free speech rights of doctors who give verbal or written recommendations to patients to use marijuana for medicinal purposes, as approved by California voters
